definition: to cut out (as a dress)/to cut/to trim/to reduce/to diminish/to cut back (e.g. on staff)/decision/judgment

sentences.chinese: 這套衣服裁製得很漂亮。
他的夾克裁製得很漂亮。

sentences.english: Khaki tote bags and metallic suede clutch bags appeal to you, since you want your accessories to be as eclectic as you are.
sentences.chinese: 卡其布或金屬的小山羊皮裁製手提包都很襯你哦。

sentences.english: Mr. Jones tailors for the king .
sentences.chinese: 瓊斯先生爲國王裁製衣服。

sentences.english: This material will make up into three dresses.
sentences.chinese: 這塊料子可以裁製三件衣服。

sentences.english: She was now arrayed in the most costly garments, all silk and muslin.
sentences.chinese: 而今她穿上了絲綢和細紗裁製的珍貴服飾。

sentences.english: A well- tailored jacket ought to set well.
sentences.chinese: 裁製合適的上衣應該很合身。

sentences.english: Therefore, it is necessery to set up a complete sports arbitration system.
sentences.chinese: 因此，構建我國完整的體育仲裁製度勢在必行。

sentences.english: Her clothing is tailored by a famous designer.
sentences.chinese: 她的衣服是由一位著名的設計師裁製的。
壽衣上沒有裁製裝錢的口袋。

definition: item made from woven silk or rayon
to feel the pulse (TCM)/Taiwan pr. [zhen3 mo4]
paper pattern as model in dressmaking/paper patten
properly/satisfactorily/firmly/very fitting/appropriate/proper/to be in good order/also written 妥帖
Guangdong embroidery, one of the four major traditional styles of Chinese embroidery (the other three being 蘇繡|苏绣[Su1 xiu4], 湘繡|湘绣[Xiang1 xiu4] and 蜀繡|蜀绣[Shu3 xiu4])
